verses.text_plain: Now Naaman, captain of the host of the king of Syria, was a great man with his master, and honourable, because by him the Lord had given deliverance unto Syria: he was also a mighty man in valour, but he was a leper.
verses.verse_html:
1Now Naaman, captain of the host of the king of Syria, was a great man with his master, and honourable, because by him the Lord had given deliverance unto Syria: he was also a mighty man in valour, but he was a leper. ▼
▼ with: Heb. before
 , ▼
▼ honourable: or, gracious: Heb. lifted up, or, accepted in countenance
 , ▼
▼ deliverance: or, victory

footnotes.body_text: ▼ honourable: or, gracious: Heb. lifted up, or, accepted in countenance
footnotes.body_html: ▼ honourable: or, gracious: Heb. lifted up, or, accepted in countenance

verses.text_plain: And the Syrians had gone out by companies, and had brought away captive out of the land of Israel a little maid; and she waited on Naaman’s wife.
verses.verse_html:
2And the Syrians had gone out by companies, and had brought away captive out of the land of Israel a little maid; and she waited on Naaman’s wife. ▼
▼ waited…: Heb. was before

footnotes.body_html: ▼ waited…: Heb. was before

verses.text_plain: And she said unto her mistress, Would God my lord were with the prophet that is in Samaria! for he would recover him of his leprosy.
verses.verse_html:
3And she said unto her mistress, Would God my lord were with the prophet that is in Samaria! for he would recover him of his leprosy. ▼
▼ with: Heb. before
 , ▼
▼ recover: Heb. gather in

footnotes.body_html: ▼ recover: Heb. gather in

verses.text_plain: And one went in, and told his lord, saying, Thus and thus said the maid that is of the land of Israel.
verses.verse_html: 4And one went in, and told his lord, saying, Thus and thus said the maid that is of the land of Israel.

verses.text_plain: And the king of Syria said, Go to, go, and I will send a letter unto the king of Israel. And he departed, and took with him ten talents of silver, and six thousand pieces of gold, and ten changes of raiment.
verses.verse_html:
5And the king of Syria said, Go to, go, and I will send a letter unto the king of Israel. And he departed, and took with him ten talents of silver, and six thousand pieces of gold, and ten changes of raiment. ▼
▼ with…: Heb. in his hand

footnotes.body_html: ▼ with…: Heb. in his hand

verses.text_plain: And he brought the letter to the king of Israel, saying, Now when this letter is come unto thee, behold, I have therewith sent Naaman my servant to thee, that thou mayest recover him of his leprosy.
verses.verse_html: 6And he brought the letter to the king of Israel, saying, Now when this letter is come unto thee, behold, I have therewith sent Naaman my servant to thee, that thou mayest recover him of his leprosy.

tokens.text: to thee, that thou mayest recover

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass, when the king of Israel had read the letter, that he rent his clothes, and said, Am I God, to kill and to make alive, that this man doth send unto me to recover a man of his leprosy? wherefore consider, I pray you, and see how he seeketh a quarrel against me.
verses.verse_html: 7And it came to pass, when the king of Israel had read the letter, that he rent his clothes, and said, Am I God, to kill and to make alive, that this man doth send unto me to recover a man of his leprosy? wherefore consider, I pray you, and see how he seeketh a quarrel against me.

tokens.text: And it came to pass, when the king

verses.text_plain: And it was so, when Elisha the man of God had heard that the king of Israel had rent his clothes, that he sent to the king, saying, Wherefore hast thou rent thy clothes? let him come now to me, and he shall know that there is a prophet in Israel.
verses.verse_html: 8And it was so, when Elisha the man of God had heard that the king of Israel had rent his clothes, that he sent to the king, saying, Wherefore hast thou rent thy clothes? let him come now to me, and he shall know that there is a prophet in Israel.

tokens.text: now to me, and he shall know

verses.text_plain: So Naaman came with his horses and with his chariot, and stood at the door of the house of Elisha.
verses.verse_html: 9So Naaman came with his horses and with his chariot, and stood at the door of the house of Elisha.

verses.text_plain: And Elisha sent a messenger unto him, saying, Go and wash in Jordan seven times, and thy flesh shall come again to thee, and thou shalt be clean.
verses.verse_html: 10And Elisha sent a messenger unto him, saying, Go and wash in Jordan seven times, and thy flesh shall come again to thee, and thou shalt be clean.

tokens.text: to thee, and thou shalt be clean

verses.text_plain: But Naaman was wroth, and went away, and said, Behold, I thought, He will surely come out to me, and stand, and call on the name of the Lord his God, and strike his hand over the place, and recover the leper.
verses.verse_html:
11But Naaman was wroth, and went away, and said, Behold, I thought, He will surely come out to me, and stand, and call on the name of the Lord his God, and strike his hand over the place, and recover the leper. ▼
▼ I thought: Heb. I said
 , ▼
▼ I thought…: or, I said with myself, He will surely come out, etc: Heb. I said
 , ▼
▼ strike: Heb. move up and down

footnotes.body_html: ▼ I thought: Heb. I said

footnotes.body_text: ▼ I thought…: or, I said with myself, He will surely come out, etc: Heb. I said
footnotes.body_html: ▼ I thought…: or, I said with myself, He will surely come out, etc: Heb. I said

footnotes.body_text: ▼ strike: Heb. move up and down
footnotes.body_html: ▼ strike: Heb. move up and down

verses.text_plain: Are not Abana and Pharpar, rivers of Damascus, better than all the waters of Israel? may I not wash in them, and be clean? So he turned and went away in a rage.
verses.verse_html:
12Are not Abana and Pharpar, rivers of Damascus, better than all the waters of Israel? may I not wash in them, and be clean? So he turned and went away in a rage. ▼
▼ Abana: or, Amana

verses.text_plain: And his servants came near, and spake unto him, and said, My father, if the prophet had bid thee do some great thing, wouldest thou not have done it? how much rather then, when he saith to thee, Wash, and be clean?
verses.verse_html: 13And his servants came near, and spake unto him, and said, My father, if the prophet had bid thee do some great thing, wouldest thou not have done it? how much rather then, when he saith to thee, Wash, and be clean?

verses.text_plain: Then went he down, and dipped himself seven times in Jordan, according to the saying of the man of God: and his flesh came again like unto the flesh of a little child, and he was clean.
verses.verse_html: 14Then went he down, and dipped himself seven times in Jordan, according to the saying of the man of God: and his flesh came again like unto the flesh of a little child, and he was clean.

verses.text_plain: And he returned to the man of God, he and all his company, and came, and stood before him: and he said, Behold, now I know that there is no God in all the earth, but in Israel: now therefore, I pray thee, take a blessing of thy servant.
verses.verse_html: 15And he returned to the man of God, he and all his company, and came, and stood before him: and he said, Behold, now I know that there is no God in all the earth, but in Israel: now therefore, I pray thee, take a blessing of thy servant.

tokens.text: now therefore, I pray thee, take

verses.text_plain: But he said, As the Lord liveth, before whom I stand, I will receive none. And he urged him to take it; but he refused.
verses.verse_html: 16But he said, As the Lord liveth, before whom I stand, I will receive none. And he urged him to take it; but he refused.

verses.text_plain: And Naaman said, Shall there not then, I pray thee, be given to thy servant two mules’ burden of earth? for thy servant will henceforth offer neither burnt offering nor sacrifice unto other gods, but unto the Lord.
verses.verse_html: 17And Naaman said, Shall there not then, I pray thee, be given to thy servant two mules’ burden of earth? for thy servant will henceforth offer neither burnt offering nor sacrifice unto other gods, but unto the Lord.

tokens.text: Shall there not then, I pray thee, be given

verses.text_plain: In this thing the Lord pardon thy servant, that when my master goeth into the house of Rimmon to worship there, and he leaneth on my hand, and I bow myself in the house of Rimmon: when I bow down myself in the house of Rimmon, the Lord pardon thy servant in this thing.
verses.verse_html: 18In this thing the Lord pardon thy servant, that when my master goeth into the house of Rimmon to worship there, and he leaneth on my hand, and I bow myself in the house of Rimmon: when I bow down myself in the house of Rimmon, the Lord pardon thy servant in this thing.

verses.text_plain: And he said unto him, Go in peace. So he departed from him a little way.
verses.verse_html:
19And he said unto him, Go in peace. So he departed from him a little way. ▼
▼ a little…: Heb. a little piece of ground

footnotes.body_text: ▼ a little…: Heb. a little piece of ground
footnotes.body_html: ▼ a little…: Heb. a little piece of ground

verses.text_plain: But Gehazi, the servant of Elisha the man of God, said, Behold, my master hath spared Naaman this Syrian, in not receiving at his hands that which he brought: but, as the Lord liveth, I will run after him, and take somewhat of him.
verses.verse_html: 20But Gehazi, the servant of Elisha the man of God, said, Behold, my master hath spared Naaman this Syrian, in not receiving at his hands that which he brought: but, as the Lord liveth, I will run after him, and take somewhat of him.

verses.text_plain: So Gehazi followed after Naaman. And when Naaman saw him running after him, he lighted down from the chariot to meet him, and said, Is all well?
verses.verse_html:
21So Gehazi followed after Naaman. And when Naaman saw him running after him, he lighted down from the chariot to meet him, and said, Is all well? ▼
▼ Is…: Heb. Is there peace?

footnotes.body_html: ▼ Is…: Heb. Is there peace?

verses.text_plain: And he said, All is well. My master hath sent me, saying, Behold, even now there be come to me from mount Ephraim two young men of the sons of the prophets: give them, I pray thee, a talent of silver, and two changes of garments.
verses.verse_html: 22And he said, All is well. My master hath sent me, saying, Behold, even now there be come to me from mount Ephraim two young men of the sons of the prophets: give them, I pray thee, a talent of silver, and two changes of garments.

tokens.text: Behold, even now there be come
them, I pray thee, a talent

verses.text_plain: And Naaman said, Be content, take two talents. And he urged him, and bound two talents of silver in two bags, with two changes of garments, and laid them upon two of his servants; and they bare them before him.
verses.verse_html: 23And Naaman said, Be content, take two talents. And he urged him, and bound two talents of silver in two bags, with two changes of garments, and laid them upon two of his servants; and they bare them before him.

verses.text_plain: And when he came to the tower, he took them from their hand, and bestowed them in the house: and he let the men go, and they departed.
verses.verse_html:
24And when he came to the tower, he took them from their hand, and bestowed them in the house: and he let the men go, and they departed. ▼
▼ tower: or, secret place

footnotes.body_html: ▼ tower: or, secret place

verses.text_plain: But he went in, and stood before his master. And Elisha said unto him, Whence comest thou, Gehazi? And he said, Thy servant went no whither.
verses.verse_html:
25But he went in, and stood before his master. And Elisha said unto him, Whence comest thou, Gehazi? And he said, Thy servant went no whither. ▼
▼ no whither: Heb. not hither or thither

footnotes.body_text: ▼ no whither: Heb. not hither or thither
footnotes.body_html: ▼ no whither: Heb. not hither or thither

verses.text_plain: And he said unto him, Went not mine heart with thee, when the man turned again from his chariot to meet thee? Is it a time to receive money, and to receive garments, and oliveyards, and vineyards, and sheep, and oxen, and menservants, and maidservants?
verses.verse_html: 26And he said unto him, Went not mine heart with thee, when the man turned again from his chariot to meet thee? Is it a time to receive money, and to receive garments, and oliveyards, and vineyards, and sheep, and oxen, and menservants, and maidservants?

verses.text_plain: The leprosy therefore of Naaman shall cleave unto thee, and unto thy seed for ever. And he went out from his presence a leper as white as snow.
verses.verse_html: 27The leprosy therefore of Naaman shall cleave unto thee, and unto thy seed for ever. And he went out from his presence a leper as white as snow.

tokens.text: unto thee, and unto thy seed
